issue.title: Incorrect title displayed in edit breadcrumbs

repository.name: activeadmin
repository.description: The administration framework for Ruby on Rails applications.

issue.body:
When editing a "Release" in our application, sometimes the breadcrumb displays the wrong title.  In the screenshot below you can see that it is displaying "Release 68" when the release title (labelled as Release Number) is 62.

![Screen Shot 2013-04-22 at 1 37 32 PM](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1398576/410601/6a6e327e-ab73-11e2-9aff-f28874d0b1bf.png)

I have defined a display_name method on the Release model:

``` ruby
  def display_name
    "Release #{title}"
  end
```

but this error persists.  I tried putting a binding.pry in the form action and when I test the display_name through that it comes up with "Release 62":

![Screen Shot 2013-04-22 at 1 43 36 PM](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1398576/410633/2cf4b840-ab74-11e2-8241-d2e4ba21cf1c.png)

Any idea what might be causing this? It is a small detail, but one we'd like to iron out.  Thanks for a great utility!

body: I'm also experiencing this issue, where the navigation menu only shows the current resource type, instead of the usual navigation items.
@seanlinsley I think we should be able to backport that fix to `0-6-stable`.
Currently cherry picking #2601 and running the test suite
Are there any other bug fixes in master that we should backport?
Okay it's now on [0-6-stable](https://github.com/gregbell/active_admin/commits/0-6-stable). @pietschy can you please try that branch?

issue.title: Backport bugfixes to 0.6.stable

repository.name: activeadmin
repository.description: The administration framework for Ruby on Rails applications.

issue.body:
In response to @seanlinsley's question in #2739:

Here's a quick summary of things I suspect can be cleanly backported to `0.6.stable`
- [x] Hide blank slate: ecfb8bb
- [ ] Probably can backport the advanced datepicker options (before the JS reorganization, probably)
- [ ] Possibly kaminari update
- [ ] Various translation fixes and updates
- [ ] Long menu CSS styling
- [ ] SVG Icon fixes
- [x] Probably various spec updates that have kept the spec suite passing on master.

body: @seanlinsley I did a quick review and created an issue with suspected backportable bugfixes.

Thanks @seanlinsley, the backport fixed the breadcrumb issue.

The two broken menu issues remain though.  Here's the stack trace I'm getting when a belongs_to resource has the menu set to false.

```
ActiveAdmin::MenuCollection::NoMenuError (No menu by the name of :public_course in availble menus: default, utility_navigation, public_course_day):
  vendor/cache/active_admin-d6152a061a9f/lib/active_admin/menu_collection.rb:37:in `fetch'
  vendor/cache/active_admin-d6152a061a9f/lib/active_admin/namespace.rb:103:in `fetch_menu'
  vendor/cache/active_admin-d6152a061a9f/lib/active_admin/resource/menu.rb:46:in `navigation_menu'
  vendor/cache/active_admin-d6152a061a9f/lib/active_admin/base_controller/menu.rb:14:in `current_menu'
  vendor/cache/active_admin-d6152a061a9f/lib/active_admin/base_controller/menu.rb:20:in `set_current_tab'
  activesupport (3.2.11) lib/active_support/callbacks.rb:451:in `_run__3689135116421782746__process_action__3853192467462923576__callbacks'
```
What was the version you upgraded from, where this was working?

I've been running of a custom branch based on 0.5.1 (or possibly 0.5.0 not quite sure how to tell).

https://github.com/pietschy/active_admin/tree/metec_customisations

The only changes in my branch/fork were for the body.active_admin css issue, fixes for #1362 and removing the hard coded datepicker format from the js.
see my previous issue https://github.com/gregbell/active_admin/issues/2637 as well

Using the master branch, we're experiencing this too.

This is kind of a deal-breaker, no? Is there any way to _not_ have this strange, limited menu appear for a nested resource?
@dan It looks like you can use `navigation_menu :default` to make the resource render with the main navigation menu.

@paulj I tried your suggestion but it still seems broken. It doesn't work.

I am using the master branch and have `cancan` for authorization. Do we have any tests for this?
Seeing same issue here. Agree with @yagudaev  that @paulj suggestion would break the application at the root pages, as it is asking for the parent resource id.
